title: Linux whois Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the whois command in Linux, learn its syntax, and discover practical examples to retrieve domain information and customize the output.

meta.title: Linux whois Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the whois command in Linux, learn its syntax, and discover practical examples to retrieve domain information and customize the output.
meta.keywords: whois, Linux, domain information, network, communication, lookup, command line

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Syntax of the whois Command

verify.name: Verify the whois command usage
verify.hint: Ensure that you can successfully run the `whois` command and that it returns the expected output for the `example.com` domain.

steps.title: Retrieve Domain Information Using the whois Command

verify.name: Verify the whois command for example.com
verify.hint: Ensure that you can successfully run the `whois` command for the `example.com` domain and that it returns the expected output.

verify.name: Verify the whois command for google.com
verify.hint: Ensure that you can successfully run the `whois` command for the `google.com` domain and that it returns the expected output.

steps.title: Customize whois Output and Handle Exceptions

verify.name: Verify customized whois output
verify.hint: Ensure that you can successfully run the `whois` command with the `-h` option to specify the WHOIS server, and that it returns the expected output for the `example.com` domain.

verify.name: Verify handling whois exceptions
verify.hint: Ensure that you can handle the exception when running the `whois` command for a non-existent domain, and that it returns the expected error message.
